wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-colonel Joseph Edward Crawshay Partridge (21 July 1879 – 28 August 1965) known as "The Bird" or "Birdie", was a Welsh born British Army officer and international rugby union player who was capped for South Africa and was a member of the Barbarians in that side's first international, played against Wales in 1915. He was also the founder of the Army Rugby Union.

response: *Joseph Edward Crawshay Partridge (1890–1969), Welsh born international rugby union player
*Joseph Edward Crawshay Partridge (1879–1965), Welsh rugby union player and soldier
